newsitem.title: KENYA: Demand for blue chips lift Nairobi bourse index.
newsitem.headline: Demand for blue chips lift Nairobi bourse index.

text.p: Demand for blue chip shares lifted the Nairobi Stock Exchange 20-share index marginally on Thursday, bourse officials said.
The index gained 6.86 points to close at 3338.80.
Turnover, boosted by heavy trading on the special boards, was posted at 84.803 million shillings on 1,117,399 shares compared to 60.682 million shillings on 2,195,614 shares on Wednesday.
Brokers said there was strong demand for blue chips, especially for heavily capitalised shares, like Barclays Bank, Kenya Power & Lighting.
They also said the increased inflows from foreign investors helped lift market sentiment. "There is a positive underlying tone in the market now," one official said.
Foreigners bought 83,400 shares of Uchumi Supermarket between 40.75 and 41.50 from 41 shillings and 28,100 shares of Kenya Commercial Bank at 87 and 90.50 from 92.
They traded National Industrial Credit at 50-50.50 from 52 and Firestone East Africa at 27 from 27.25.
Rea Vipingo Plantations eased to 8.70 from 9 while Sasini Tea & Coffee was unchanged at 76.50 shillings.
Nation Printers & Publishers gained three shillings to close at 163 while Kenya Airways eased to 8.55 from 8.60.
National Bank of Kenya closed at 15.90 from 15.50 while Standard Chartered Bank eased to 45.75 from 46.
Total Kenya was unchanged at 65 while Kenya Breweries closed at 58 unchanged. ($1=53.90 Kenyan Shillings)
